summary:
MAARTEN LAURENS SIMOONS, is Professor of Cardiology (emeritus) and was Chief of Cardiology, at the Thoraxcenter, Erasmus University Medical Center Rotterdam, The Netherlands. He is a fellow of the KNAW (Royal Netherlands Academy of Science and Arts), the Royal College of Physicians (London), the European Society of Cardiology and several other learned societies.
He was appointed Professor of intensive cardiac care at Erasmus University  (1990), and subsequently Professor of Cardiology (1998) and Chief of Cardiology, Chairman of the Thoraxcenter and Chairman of COEUR (cardiovascular research school at Erasmus University Rotterdam) in 2003. This position he held until his retirement in 2011.
Research interests: ischemic heart disease, coronary care, information technology, pharmacogenetics. He is a leader of many national and international clinical trials, related to acute coronary syndromes (reperfusion therapy, anti-thrombotic therapy, risk assessment) and stable coronary artery disease, including the GUSTO trials, CAPTURE, EUROPA, EXPEDITION, MAAS, PENTUA and PURSUIT. Currently he is member (chairman) of several Data Safety Monitoring Committees of international multicentre trials as well as the DSMC of Erasmus University Medical Centre and Leiden University Medical Centre.

Professor Simoons has been supervisor of 35 young scientists completing their PhD-thesis, and is the author or co-author of  > 600 publications in peer reviewed journals. See PubMed.
He was a member of the Board of the European Society of Cardiology from 1991 until 2004 and president of the Society 2000 - 2002. Furthermore he served on the board of the Interuniversity Cardiology Institute in the Netherlands (ICIN, 2003 - 2012).
From 2006 until 2013 he served as chairman of the scientific advisory board of the Netherlands Heart Foundation. 
He received the Snellen medal of the Netherlands Heart Foundation (2014)
In 2010 he was honoured as Ridder in de Orde van de Nederlandse Leeuw.
